section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The phrase "in a timely manner" introduces ambiguity. While the previous sentence specifies the 5th day of each month as the payment deadline, "timely manner" is subjective and could be interpreted differently. This creates an in-text contradiction as it is not specifically defined when payments are considered 'timely'.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: There is an inconsistency in the consequences for late payments. While the Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month, it mentions that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site. This implies that i-on can terminate or discontinue services, for the same infraction, which is never mentioned in the agreement.

section: The Customer shall comply with applicable laws, standards, policies, and procedures. The Customer incurs the responsibility to determine what restrictions apply and to review the policies and procedures that will be updated continually.
explanation: The contract vaguely states that 'The Customer shall comply with applicable laws, standards, policies and procedures.' This is a sweeping statement without specifying which laws, standards, policies, and procedures apply, making it difficult to determine compliance and enforce this clause. Without clear definitions, this introduces ambiguity and is difficult to enforce under state or national law because it doesn't specify which laws the customer must comply with.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: The text states the agreement renews for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods'. This creates ambiguity. Does it renew for only one month? Or can it renew for multiple months at a time? This lack of clarity can lead to disputes.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: There is an inconsistency in the termination clauses. The contract states the agreement will automatically be renewed for one or more months unless either party gives 15 days notice, but also states that either party can terminate the agreement at any time with 30 days written notice. The inconsistency lies in the automatic renewal of the contract after the intial six month period.

section: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, no termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever shall relieve the Customer of the obligation to pay all amounts due to i-on and to make such payments on a timely basis.
explanation: The phrase "on a timely basis" reintroduces ambiguity after the contract has already specified payment terms. This creates an in-text contradiction.
